result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaucinda R Tierson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Violence surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--random drug and/ or alcohol screening at the discretion of the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--anger management and/ or criminal thinking course at the discretion of the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--submit a DNA sample to designee/Sheriff upon demand

Arresting Agency: Watertown Police Department

The Court informs Ms. Tierson that she has the right to request expungement of DNA sample. 

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that all costs and fees remaining in both Case 15CM161 and 15CM163 are to be converted to Civil Judgment

The Court sentences Ms. Tierson to 45 days in the Jefferson County Jail, this sentence is to begin FORTHWITH; this sentence is WITHOUT work release/Huber.

Court orders that the way the custody will apply is that in case 15CM163 she is entitled to 19 days. That was her pretrial detention credit, and then after that the next 91 days will be applied. Obviously, it won't be the totality of that. It will be whatever it is the math that works out to go from 19 to the 45 that the Court ordered, but Ms. Tierson gets good time on that. So that will have to be deducted and the balance of that 91 is applied there. Then the rest of the 91, because of the consecutive nature is applied in case 15CM161 against the three months the Court ordered in Count #1. If there's anything left then, the 18 days she had from the Judgment of Conviction is applied on Count 1 and then if there's nothing left, Ms. Tierson will have to serve what is remaining then the balance on Count 2 if there's some credit left then it spills over and comes off the top of Count 2. The judgments of conviction should be clear that Mr. Tierson's not entitled to anything more than a total credit of 18 plus 19 plus 91 between two cases.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaucinda R Tierson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CM163 and 15CM161 called together at 11:00am [mo]
[Scheduled for Sentencing after Revocation]
Defendant Jaucinda R Tierson in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance in both files

Atty. De La Rosa makes one factual correction to Revocation and Warrant packet from DOC

ADA Shock gives sentencing arguments
Atty. De La Rosa gives sentencing arguments
Statement made by Ms. Tierson


On Cases 15CM161 & 15CM163 the Court sentences Ms. Tierson to:

On Case 15CM163 Count #1: The Court sentences Ms. Tierson to 45 days in the Jefferson County Jail, this sentence is to begin FORTHWITH; this sentence is WITHOUT work release/Huber.
On Case 15CM161 Count #1: The Court sentences Ms. Tierson to 3 months in the Jefferson County Jail; this sentence is to be served consecutive to the sentence in Case 15CM163; this sentence is WITHOUT work release/Huber.
On Case 15CM161 Count #3: The Court sentences Ms. Tierson to 2 months in the Jefferson County Jail; this sentence is to be served consecutive to the sentence in Case 15CM163 and sentence in Count #1 of Case 15CM161; this sentence is WITHOUT work release/Huber.

The Court orders that all costs and fees remaining in both Case 15CM161 and 15CM163 are to be converted to Civil Judgement against Mr. Tierson in favor of the County/State
As to Case 15CM163: 19 days credit
As to Case 15CM161, Count #1: 
As to Case 15CM161, Count #3: 
The Court directs that the Days Credit for both cases shall not exceed 18 plus 19 plus 91 in both cases.
**************MINUTES ARE NOT FINISHED********************************************
recess: 11:50am
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-02-2015 11:00 am
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 15CM59, 15CM161 and 15CM163 called together at 10:06am 
Defendant Jaucinda R Tierson in court, in custody with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Case 15CM161 Counts #1 and #3 and Case 15CM163 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified in all cases; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses:  Case 15CM59 and all remaining counts of 15CM161 and 15CM163

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Ms. Tierson makes statement 

On Case 15CM161 Counts #1 and #3 and Case 15CM163 Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--random drug and/ or alcohol screening at the discretion of the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--anger management and/ or criminal thinking course at the discretion of the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--submit a DNA sample to designee/Sheriff upon demand
--Case 15CM161 Count #1:to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--Case 15CM161 Count #3:to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $50 Drug Testing Fee
--Case 15CM163 Count #1:to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Violence surcharge

Case 15CM161: Days credit for time already served:  18  days
Case 15CM163: Days credit for time already served:  19  days

The Court informs Ms. Tierson that she has the right to request expungement of DNA sample. 
recess: 10:41am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 09:40 am.

Cases 15CM161 and 15CM163 called at 1:40pm [mo]
Defendant Jaucinda R Tierson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial demanded by the Defense 

Bond arguments given by Atty. Flint
Bond arguments given by Atty. Huebner

The Court requires a $350  cash bond to cover both case 15CM161 and 15CM163, with conditions:
--no contact with Jennifer Farmer
--no presence at the residence of Jennifer Farmer
--to maintain absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no acts or threats of violence
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no precense at Pick n Save in Watertown
--no contact with D.L.J dob 3/18/97
--no contact with A.E.B dob 7/7/99
--no contact with K.A.R.O dob 7/2/2000

recess 2:02pm  pm. 


NEXT: Scheduled with Mr. Tierson's other case 15CM59----(1) Pretrial Conference on May 20, 2015 at 9:40am   (2) Status Conference on June 15, 2015 at 3:00pm (3) Speedy Trial Demanded--please set for Trial 60 days from today.
